Yousef Ourabi wrote:
> Hello all again...
> I allocted 512M to the Java heap with the following
> command
> 
> export JAVA_OPTS="-Xmx512M"
> 
> I get this out of memory error:
> 
> An error occured
> 
> java.lang.OutOfMemoryError
> 
> java.lang.OutOfMemoryError
> 
> You may be able to recover by going back
> 
> 
> 
> ??? Help...This is not my day with heritrix today...

It appears you got this error while interacting with the web UI. What
had you just attempted to do?

I think there may be a problem in 1.0.0 and HEAD where a completed
crawl's running structures are kept around -- essentially creating
a memory leak.

It'd be especially likely to cause problems at the moment a subsequent
crawl is launched, as a batch of new object creation (including one giant
object) happens at that time.

This looks like a new bug: old crawls used to be garbage collected
throughly. I'm investigating.

Another observation about memory usage: because Heritrix queues URIs
by host, and a number of other key structures and policies exist
per-host, its memory usage is more sensitive to the total number of
unique hosts discovered than the total number of URIs discovered/
crawled/pending.

So, while Heritrix 1.0.0 could crawl 10 million pages from a hundred hosts
in a reaonable amount of heap RAM (possibly as little as 256M), crawling
just 1 million pages spread out over 50,000 hosts would require a much
larger heap.

- Gordon @ IA
